parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma1

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Math - Vectors

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns object's normalized direction vector in world space (<tt>[x,y,z]</tt>). 
* A unit facing North would return <tt>[0,1,0]</tt>
* A unit facing East would return <tt>[1,0,0]</tt>
* A unit facing South would return <tt>[0,-1,0]</tt>
* A unit facing West would return <tt>[-1,0,0]</tt>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value>[[vectorDir]] object

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> object: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] - format [[Vector3D]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_dirVector = [[vectorDir]] _unit;</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[vectorModelToWorld]], [[vectorDirVisual]], [[vectorUp]], [[setVectorDir]], [[setVectorUp]], [[setVectorDirAndUp]], [[vectorDiff]], [[vectorAdd]], [[vectorMultiply]], [[vectorCrossProduct]], [[vectorDistance]], [[vectorMagnitudeSqr]], [[vectorDistanceSqr]], [[vectorCos]], [[vectorMagnitude]], [[vectorDotProduct]], [[vectorNormalized]], [[vectorFromTo]], [[BIS_fnc_transformVectorDirAndUp]]
</value></part></template>
